translated: Discussion of the duration of consciousness
Is it the case that a single consciousness lasts for a day?

analyzed: upaḍḍha divasaḥ uppāda kkhaṇaḥ upaḍḍha divasaḥ vaya kkhaṇo ti
translated: Is it the case that half a day is the time of arising and half a day is the time of dissolution?

analyzed: ekam cittam dve divase tiṭṭhati iti
translated: Is it the case that a single consciousness lasts for two days?

analyzed: divasaḥ uppāda kkhaṇaḥ divasaḥ vaya kkhaṇaḥ ti
translated: Is it the case that one day is the time of arising and one day is the time of dissolution?
Is it the case that a single consciousness lasts for four days …

analyzed: aṭṭha divase tiṭṭhati  dasa divase tiṭṭhati
aṭṭha vassāni tiṭṭhati  dasa vassāni tiṭṭhati
vīsati vassāni tiṭṭhati  tisa vassāni tiṭṭhati
paññāsa vassāni tiṭṭhati  vassa satam tiṭṭhati
pañca vassa satāni tiṭṭhati  vassa sahassam tiṭṭhati
soḷasa vassa sahassāni tiṭṭhati  kappam tiṭṭhati
soḷasa kappe tiṭṭhati  bāttisa kappe tiṭṭhati
aṭṭha kappa sahassāni tiṭṭhati  soḷasa kappa sahassāni tiṭṭhati

original: Dvecattārīsa kappasahassāni uppādakkhaṇo, dvecattārīsa kappasahassāni vayakkhaṇoti?
analyzed: dvecattārīsa kappa sahassāni uppāda kkhaṇaḥ dvecattārīsa kappa sahassāni vaya kkhaṇaḥ ti
translated: ‘The moment of arising lasts for forty-two thousand eons, and the moment of passing away lasts for forty-two thousand eons’?
“That is not so by reason of the Blessed One’s statement.”
‘A single thought lasts for a day’?

original: Atthaññe dhammā ekāhaṁ bahumpi uppajjitvā nirujjhantīti?
analyzed: atthaññe dhammā ekāham bahum pi uppajjitvā nirujjhanti iti
translated: ‘Other things arise and cease many times in a day’?

analyzed: te dhammā cittena lahu parivattā ati
translated: ‘Are those things more changeable than the mind’?
“That is not so by reason of the Blessed One’s statement.”

analyzed: te dhammā cittena lahu parivattā ati
translated: ‘Are those things more changeable than the mind’?
‘But hasn’t it been said by the Buddha?

original: “nāhaṁ, bhikkhave, aññaṁ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi evaṁ lahuparivattaṁ yathayidaṁ cittaṁ.
analyzed: na aha bhikkhave aññam eka dhammam pi samanupassāmi evam lahu parivattam yathā idam citta
translated: “Bhikkhus, I do not see even one other thing that is so changeable as the mind.

original: Yāvañcidaṁ, bhikkhave, upamāpi na sukarā yāva lahuparivattaṁ cittan”ti.
analyzed: yāvañcida bhikkhave upamā api na sukarā yāva lahu parivattam cittam ti
translated: It is not easy to give a simile for how changeable the mind is.”

analyzed: te dhammā cittena lahu parivattā ati
translated: that those things are more changeable than the mind.’

analyzed: te dhammā cittena lahu parivattā ati
translated: Are those things turned over by the mind?
But hasn’t it been said by the Blessed One:

original: “seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, makkaṭo araññe pavane caramāno sākhaṁ gaṇhati, taṁ muñcitvā aññaṁ gaṇhati, taṁ muñcitvā aññaṁ gaṇhati;
analyzed: seyyathā api bhikkhave makkaṭaḥ araññe pavane caramāno sākham gaṇhati tam muñcitvā aññam gaṇhati tam muñcitvā aññam gaṇhati
translated: ‘Just as a monkey in the forest, wandering through the woods, grabs hold of one branch, lets go, grabs hold of another, lets go, grabs hold of yet another, lets go,

original: evameva kho, bhikkhave, yamidaṁ vuccati cittaṁ itipi mano itipi viññāṇaṁ itipi taṁ rattiyā ca divasassa ca aññadeva uppajjati aññaṁ nirujjhatī”ti.
analyzed: evam eva kho bhikkhave yam idam vuccati cittam iti pi manaḥ iti pi viññāṇam iti pi tam rattiyā ca divasassa ca aññadeva uppajjati aññam nirujjhati iti
translated: in the same way, whatever is the mind, the awareness, the consciousness, the intelligence, the discernment, the clear knowing, the clear knowing faculty, the mind, the mind principle, the mind faculty, that is said to arise as one thing and cease as another during the day and night.’

analyzed: te dhammā cittena lahu parivattā ati
translated: Are those things turned over by the mind?
Does one consciousness last for a day?
Does eye-consciousness last for a day?

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe  sota viññāṇam pe
ghāna viññāṇam  jivhā viññāṇam  kāya viññāṇam
translated: tongue-consciousness …🔽body-consciousness …🔽Does unskillful consciousness …🔽consciousness accompanied by passion …🔽consciousness accompanied by aversion …

analyzed: akusalam cittam  rāga sahagatam  dosa sahagatam  moha sahagatam
translated: consciousness accompanied by delusion …🔽consciousness accompanied by conceit …

that is without shame …🔽that is without fear of wrongdoing …🔽that is without restraint …🔽that is without clear comprehension …🔽that is not concentrated …

original: Yeneva cittena abhikkamati, teneva cittena paṭikkamati;
analyzed: yena iva cittena abhikkamati tena iva cittena paṭikkamati
translated: that is not liberated by wisdom …🔽that is not

original: yeneva cittena paṭikkamati, teneva cittena abhikkamati;🔽yeneva cittena āloketi, teneva cittena viloketi;
analyzed: yena iva cittena paṭikkamati tena iva cittena abhikkamati  yena iva cittena āloketi tena iva cittena viloketi
translated: with the same thought with which he goes forward, he goes back;🔽with the same thought with which he looks, he looks away;

original: yeneva cittena viloketi, teneva cittena āloketi;
analyzed: yena iva cittena tena iva cittena āloketi
translated: with the same thought with which he looks away, he looks;

original: yeneva cittena samiñjeti, teneva cittena pasāreti;
analyzed: yena iva cittena samiñjeti tena iva cittena pasāreti
translated: with the same thought with which he bends in, he extends;

original: yeneva cittena pasāreti, teneva cittena samiñjetīti?
analyzed: yena iva cittena pasāreti tena iva cittena samiñjeti iti
translated: with the same thought with which he extends, he bends in?”

original: Ākāsānañcāyatanūpagānaṁ devānaṁ ekaṁ cittaṁ yāvatāyukaṁ tiṭṭhatīti?
analyzed: ākāsānañcāyatana upagānam devānam ekam cittam yāvatāyukam tiṭṭhati iti
translated: “The devas of the base of infinite space have one thought that lasts for an eon?”

analyzed: manussānam ekam cittam yāvatāyukam tiṭṭhati iti
translated: “Humans have one thought that lasts for an eon?”

original: Ākāsānañcāyatanūpagānaṁ devānaṁ ekaṁ cittaṁ yāvatāyukaṁ tiṭṭhatīti?
analyzed: ākāsānañcāyatana upagānam devānam ekam cittam yāvatāyukam tiṭṭhati iti
translated: “The devas of the base of infinite space have one thought that lasts for an eon?”

original: Cātumahārājikānaṁ devānaṁ …pe…🔽tāvatiṁsānaṁ devānaṁ …🔽yāmānaṁ devānaṁ …🔽tusitānaṁ devānaṁ …🔽nimmānaratīnaṁ devānaṁ …
analyzed: cātumahārājikānam devānam pe  tau atisānam devānam  yāmānam devānam  tusitānam devānam  nimmāna ratīnam devānam
translated: “The devas of the Four Great Kings …🔽the devas who control the creations of others …🔽the devas who delight in creation …
the devas who wield power over others’ creations …
the devas of the retinue of Brahma …
the gods who are Brahmā’s Retinue …
the gods who are Great Brahmā …🔽the gods who are Limited Radiance …

analyzed: appamāṇa ābhānam devānam  ābhassarānam devānam  devānam
translated: the gods who are Immeasurable Radiance …🔽the gods who are Streaming Radiance …🔽the gods who are Limited Glory …
the gods who are Immeasurable Glory …🔽the gods who are Refulgent Glory …🔽the gods who are Well-Appeared …

analyzed: vehapphalānam devānam  a vihānam  a tappānam devānam
translated: the gods who are Unsurpassed …🔽the gods who are Faultless …🔽the gods who are Clear-sighted …

original: akaniṭṭhānaṁ devānaṁ ekaṁ cittaṁ yāvatāyukaṁ tiṭṭhatīti?
analyzed: akaniṭṭhānam devānam ekam cittam yāvatāyukam tiṭṭhati iti
translated: “Is it the case that the one thought of the gods who are Not-Causing-Rebirth lasts for their entire lifespan?”

original: Ākāsānañcāyatanūpagānaṁ devānaṁ vīsati kappasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṁ, ākāsānañcāyatanūpagānaṁ devānaṁ ekaṁ cittaṁ vīsati kappasahassāni tiṭṭhatīti?
analyzed: ākāsānañcāyatana upagānam devānam vīsati kappa sahassāni āyu ppamāṇaḥ ākāsānañcāyatana upagānam devānam ekam cittam vīsati kappa sahassāni tiṭṭhati iti
translated: “Is it the case that the lifespan of the gods who are in the base of infinite space is twenty thousand eons, and that the one thought of the gods who are in the base of infinite space lasts for twenty thousand eons?”

original: Manussānaṁ vassasataṁ āyuppamāṇaṁ, manussānaṁ ekaṁ cittaṁ vassasataṁ tiṭṭhatīti?
analyzed: manussānam vassa satam āyu ppamāṇa manussānam ekam cittam vassa satam tiṭṭhati iti
translated: “Is it the case that the lifespan of human beings is one hundred years, and that the one thought of human beings lasts for one hundred years?”

original: Ākāsānañcāyatanūpagānaṁ devānaṁ vīsati kappasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṁ, ākāsānañcāyatanūpagānaṁ devānaṁ ekaṁ cittaṁ vīsati kappasahassāni tiṭṭhatīti?
analyzed: ākāsānañcāyatana upagānam devānam vīsati kappa sahassāni āyu ppamāṇaḥ ākāsānañcāyatana upagānam devānam ekam cittam vīsati kappa sahassāni tiṭṭhati iti
translated: “The lifespan of the gods of the base of infinite space is twenty thousand eons. Does the mind of the gods of the base of infinite space remain for twenty thousand eons?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Cātumahārājikānaṁ devānaṁ pañca vassasatāni āyuppamāṇaṁ, cātumahārājikānaṁ devānaṁ ekaṁ cittaṁ pañca vassasatāni tiṭṭhati …
analyzed: āmantā  cātumahārājikānam devānam pañca vassa satāni āyu ppamāṇa cātumahārājikānam devānam ekam cittam pañca vassa satāni tiṭṭhati
translated: “Yes.”🔽“The lifespan of the gods of the four great kings is five hundred years. Does the mind of the gods of the four great kings remain for five hundred years?”

original: soḷasa vassasahassāni tiṭṭhati …🔽kappassa tatiyabhāgaṁ tiṭṭhati …🔽upaḍḍhakappaṁ tiṭṭhati …
analyzed: soḷasa vassa sahassāni tiṭṭhati  kappassa tatiya bhāgam tiṭṭhati  upaḍḍha kappam tiṭṭhati
translated: sixteen thousand years …🔽one third of an eon …🔽half an eon …

analyzed: soḷasa kappe tiṭṭhati  bāttisa kappe tiṭṭhati

original: akaniṭṭhānaṁ devānaṁ soḷasa kappasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṁ, akaniṭṭhānaṁ devānaṁ ekaṁ cittaṁ soḷasa kappasahassāni tiṭṭhatīti?
analyzed: akaniṭṭhānam devānam soḷasa kappa sahassāni āyu ppamāṇa akaniṭṭhānam devānam ekam cittam soḷasa kappa sahassāni tiṭṭhati iti
translated: … the life span of the gods of the base of nothingness is sixteen thousand eons, and the consciousness of the gods of the base of nothingness lasts for sixteen thousand eons?”

original: Ākāsānañcāyatanūpagānaṁ devānaṁ cittaṁ muhuttaṁ muhuttaṁ uppajjati muhuttaṁ muhuttaṁ nirujjhatīti?
analyzed: ākāsa ānañc āyatana upagānam devānam cittam muhuttam muhuttam uppajjati muhuttam muhuttam nirujjhati iti
translated: “The consciousness of the gods of the dimension of infinite space arises and ceases from moment to moment?”

original: Ākāsānañcāyatanūpagā devā muhuttaṁ muhuttaṁ cavanti muhuttaṁ muhuttaṁ uppajjantīti?
analyzed: ākāsānañcāyatana upagāḥ devāḥ muhuttam muhuttam cavanti muhuttam muhuttam uppajjanti iti
translated: “The gods of the dimension of infinite space die and are reborn from moment to moment?”

original: Ākāsānañcāyatanūpagānaṁ devānaṁ ekaṁ cittaṁ yāvatāyukaṁ tiṭṭhatīti?
analyzed: ākāsānañcāyatana upagānam devānam ekam cittam yāvatāyukam tiṭṭhati iti
translated: “The consciousness of the gods of the dimension of infinite space lasts for the whole lifespan?”

original: Ākāsānañcāyatanūpagā devā yeneva cittena uppajjanti, teneva cittena cavantīti?
analyzed: ākāsānañcāyatana upagāḥ devāḥ yena iva cittena uppajjanti tena iva cittena cavanti iti
translated: “The gods of the dimension of infinite space die with the same consciousness with which they were reborn?”
The discussion of the duration of consciousness is finished.
